overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. While LinkedIn has the largest follower base, engagement is distributed across platforms. The content is largely geared towards academic and research communities.

contentThemes.description: Posts related to research projects, methodologies, and findings in computational social science.
Content focused on the study and detection of disinformation campaigns and coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Posts advertising job openings, research grants, and opportunities for students and researchers.
Announcements of new software releases and updates for social media analysis.

recommendations: Increase cross-promotion between platforms to leverage the follower base on each.
Use more visuals (images, videos) to increase engagement.
Run polls or Q&A sessions to drive interaction.
Tailor content more specifically to each platform's audience.
Use relevant hashtags more consistently to increase visibility.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky posts focus on research announcements and conference presentations, generating decent repost activity, which suggests good information dissemination.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon posts focus on research releases and methodological discussions. Engagement is the lowest among the three platforms.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn posts revolve around professional opportunities and research grants, resulting in high likes and comments, indicating a strong professional network.
